Ephesians__05.1: Be ye therefore followers of God, as most dear children;
Ephesians__05.2: And walk in love, as Christ also hath loved us, and hath delivered himself for us, an oblation and a sacrifice to God for an odour of sweetness.
Ephesians__05.3: But fornication, and all uncleanness, or covetousness, let it not so much as be named among you, as becometh saints:
Ephesians__05.4: Or obscenity, or foolish talking, or scurrility, which is to no purpose; but rather giving of thanks.
Ephesians__05.5: For know you this and understand, that no fornicator, or unclean, or covetous person (which is a serving of idols), hath inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God.
Ephesians__05.6: Let no man deceive you with vain words. For because of these things cometh the anger of God upon the children of unbelief.
Ephesians__05.7: Be ye not therefore partakers with them.
Ephesians__05.8: For you were heretofore darkness, but now light in the Lord. Walk then as children of the light.
Ephesians__05.9: For the fruit of the light is in all goodness, and justice, and truth;
Ephesians__05.10: Proving what is well pleasing to God:
Ephesians__05.11: And have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather reprove them.
Ephesians__05.12: For the things that are done by them in secret, it is a shame even to speak of.
Ephesians__05.13: But all things that are reproved, are made manifest by the light; for all that is made manifest is light.
Ephesians__05.14: Wherefore he saith: Rise thou that sleepest, and arise from the dead: and Christ shall enlighten thee.
Ephesians__05.15: See therefore, brethren, how you walk circumspectly: not as unwise,
Ephesians__05.16: But as wise: redeeming the time, because the days are evil.
Ephesians__05.17: Wherefore become not unwise, but understanding what is the will of God.
Ephesians__05.18: And be not drunk with wine, wherein is luxury; but be ye filled with the holy Spirit,
Ephesians__05.19: Speaking to yourselves in psalms, and hymns, and spiritual canticles, singing and making melody in your hearts to the Lord;
Ephesians__05.20: Giving thanks always for all things, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, to God and the Father:
Ephesians__05.21: Being subject one to another, in the fear of Christ.
Ephesians__05.22: Let women be subject to their husbands, as to the Lord:
Ephesians__05.23: Because the husband is the head of the wife, as Christ is the head of the church. He is the saviour of his body.
Ephesians__05.24: Therefore as the <u>church is subject to Christ</u>, so also let the wives be to their husbands in all things.
Ephesians__05.25: Husbands, love your wives, as Christ also loved the church, and delivered himself up for it:
Ephesians__05.26: That he might sanctify it, cleansing it by the laver of water in the word of life:
Ephesians__05.27: That he might present it to himself a glorious church, not having spot or wrinkle, or any such thing; but that it should be holy, and without blemish.
Ephesians__05.28: So also ought men to love their wives as their own bodies. He that loveth his wife, loveth himself.
Ephesians__05.29: For no man ever hated his own flesh; but nourisheth and cherisheth it, as also Christ doth the church:
Ephesians__05.30: Because we are members of his body, of his flesh, and of his bones.
Ephesians__05.31: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and shall cleave to his wife, and they shall be two in one flesh.
Ephesians__05.32: This is a great sacrament; but I speak in Christ and in the church.
Ephesians__05.33: Nevertheless let every one of you in particular love his wife as himself: and let the wife fear her husband.
